#step1: Step 1: analyze and extract function points
The extracted fine-grained function points: 1.undo the last move in single-player mode. 2.save the game in single-player mode. 3.chat in real-time. 4.change icons/pictures and names during the game.

#step2: Step 2: locate the incompleteness
The spec 1 allows undoing the last move in single-player mode. The spec 2 allows real-time chat. The spec 3 allows changing icons/pictures and names during the game. However, the function point about saving the game in single-player mode is not covered by the specifications. This is S1: there exists a functional point clearly not resolved.

#step3: Step 3: Detect the specific incompleteness
Because the incompleteness belongs to S1, we proceed to Step 3.1. The uncovered function point is the ability to save the game in single-player mode. This incompleteness belongs to branch coverage incompleteness as a necessary situation is not considered.

#step4: Step 4: Summary and Generation
Based on the requirement context and the absence of the ability to save the game in single-player mode, generate the new spec:
The system shall allow users to save the game progress in single-player mode.

regen.absent_element: ability to save the game in single-player mode
regen.new_specification: The system shall allow users to save the game progress in single-player mode.
